resources.string: Collecting data in the field has traditionally required writing and transcribing from paper notebooks. Field Book was created as a digital solution for data capture that enables increased collection speed with greater data integrity.

Data is entered into Field Book with custom trait layouts that are designed to simplify data input and minimize mistakes.\n\n By default, collected data is stored locally, but Field Book supports the Breeding API which allows it to send data to BrAPI-compatible systems.
To get started using Field Book, grant the necessary permissions for the app and then define a folder where your data will be stored.
Define a folder where your data will be stored.
These optional settings customize Field Book and can be adjusted in the Field Book Settings.
Import a sample database that includes example fields and traits.
Add a help icon to the top toolbar that describes features throughout the app.
Enable a high contrast theme for better visibility on eInk devices.
Please select or create a folder that Field Book can use to store app data.
Importing files requires access to the device\'s files.
Exporting data requires access to the device\'s files.
Collecting data requires access to the device\'s files, microphone, and camera.
Database could not retrieve a field or plot with code: %s
Something went wrong when searching for %s
Search all plots and fields to load/navigate to the barcoded item.
No field book directories could be found.
No field is currently loaded. Please load a field before collecting data.
No traits exist. Please create traits before collecting data.
You have selected the active field to archive. If you continue, there will be no active field. Do you want to continue?
This field is currently archived. If you continue, this field will be unarchived and become the active field. Do you want to continue?
Opens a menu for the selected field.
Opens a dialog to add a new attribute to sort by.
Are you sure you want to delete this field? This will delete all data from this field.

Button to choose linear plot pattern.

Only TRT files can be imported as a trait list

Open a menu specific to this trait.
Deleting a trait also deletes data that has been collected for that trait. Are you sure you want to delete this trait?
Default, minimum, and maximum are required and must be numeric

Traits cannot be updated to BrAPI traits.

Value is larger than allowed maximum

Do you want to save the name of the person collecting data?
Data grid failed to load your data.
Locked - data entry, modification and deletion are disabled
Frozen - once data is saved it cannot be modified or deleted
Unlocked - no restrictions on data entry, modification, or deletion
Your device does not have a camera that can be used to take a photo.
Are you sure you want to delete this photo?
Press to open a camera view for capturing.
You have a saved coordinate for this unit, are you sure you want to update it?
Please wait while the incoming locations are being averaged…
Disconnects from the current GPS device.
Opens a dialog with possible GPS devices to connect to.
Button that opens a calendar picker.
This will save the current selected date.
Communicating with GoPro BLE, this may take a minute.

Button which prints labels configured in this dialog.

You must enter a value before creating a new observation.
Displays the number of repeated values.

This will navigate you to the closest plot.

If you utilize Field Book for research, please cite the following journal article:
Rife, T.W., and J.A. Poland. 2014. Field Book: An Open-Source Application for Field Data Collection on Android. Crop Sci. 54(4): 1624–1627.
BrAPI must be enabled first in the BrAPI settings.
When files are exported, a share dialog will be displayed

Add a button to display a grid of collected data

Require data to move either direction
Arrows skip entries that already have values for the current trait
Arrows skip entries that already have values for all traits

Use day of year when collecting data instead of the date
The %s method used to search for plots in GeoNav
The shorter base of the trapezoid is %s km
The distance from the user to the opposite end of the trapezoid is %s km
GeoNav creates a trapezoid in front of the user, the angle closest to the user is defined as %s°
Limited: Logging closest entry to storage/geonav/limited_log.txt
Full: Logging all location updates and algorithm steps to storage/geonav/log.txt
Both: Logging all location updates and algorithm steps to storage/geonav/log.txt, closest entry to storage/geonav/limited_log.txt
The time between location updates is %ss
Play plonk sound when the primary order changes
Play advance sound when moving between entries
Play cycle sound when traits are completely cycled through
Play delete sound when observation is deleted

Migrate or define a new root directory structure. Export files will be saved here automatically.
All data will be deleted. Are you sure you want to reset the database?

Warning: this will reset all of Field Book\'s preferences.
Enables multiple values to be collected for each entry/trait
Any repeated values that have been collected will be hidden until this feature is enabled again

Trait level audio is already recording. Stop that first.

Selecting a field in the fields list opens a detail page

Enabling this feature will switch the barcode scanning library from ZXing to MLKit

The Breeding API allows simple data transfer to compatible databases.

Traits and fields imported via BrAPI will be able to export their observations via the BrAPI export. Traits and fields created manually or imported via CSV will need to be exported via CSV format.
Would you like to enable the tutorial?
This setting can be changed in the Settings
Would you like to enable the tutorial? This setting can be changed in the Settings.
InfoBars show extra data for each entry and can be changed using the dropdown menus.
The small, green arrows move between traits.
The current trait being collected. A list of active traits is displayed when the current trait is pressed.
The large, black arrows move between entries.
This is where the primary and secondary order are displayed.
Data is entered in the bottom area of the screen. Different trait types have different layouts.
The NA button is used to mark values as missing.
Data is deleted using this button.
The search icon allows database queries.
This displays a list of files in the Resources folder.
This displays a summary of all data for the current entry.
allows you to import and manage fields.
To start using Field Book, first import a field file.
allows you to add, import, and manage traits.
allows you to collect phenotypic data.
allows additional configuration for data collection.
Data can be exported in two formats: database or table.
Files must contain three columns: a unique identifier, a primary order, and a secondary order. The primary/secondary order are used for navigation in the field.
A field is selected for data collection after being imported.
To delete a field, open the menu on the left side of a field name and select Delete.
Add Trait creates a new trait. Different trait formats have different collection layouts.
Different trait formats are indicated with different icons.
Traits can be disabled from collection by toggling the checkbox.
Shutter button for snapping a picture.
The trapezoidal method requires an accelerometer and gyroscope to use compass input.
Add to total count by one
Subtracts one day from the current date
Adds one day to the current date

This opens a 2D phenotyping grid of the currently selected field.
This will start a field-level audio recording.
This will open a dialog to manage the repeated values for the current observation unit.
This will open a configuration dialog to help with field navigation.
Authorization request failed, please check your BrAPI settings.
Only the latest repeated measures value will be exported in table format.
Choose between the default Field Book camera and the Android camera app.
Please plug in a UVC compatible web cam.
This name is used to find your device\'s AP. This name must be contained within the actual SSID.
This is the ip displayed on your camera when setting up the AP.
This is the port displayed on your camera when setting up the AP.
This will open a URL to the FieldBook Canon manual.
A preferences for developers to monitor device output.
